org.apache.kudu.client

Class Operation

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.kudu.client.KuduRpc<OperationResponse>
      • org.apache.kudu.client.Operation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Delete, Insert, Update, Upsert

    @InterfaceAudience.Public
 @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public abstract class Operation
extends org.apache.kudu.client.KuduRpc<OperationResponse>
    Base class for the RPCs that related to WriteRequestPB. It contains almost all the logic and knows how to serialize its child classes. TODO(todd): this should not extend KuduRpc. Rather, we should make single-operation writes just use a Batch instance with a single operation in it.

      • Fields inherited from class org.apache.kudu.client.KuduRpc

    • Method Detail

      • partitionKey

        public byte[] partitionKey()
        Description copied from class: org.apache.kudu.client.KuduRpc
        Returns the partition key this RPC is for, or null if the RPC is not tablet specific.

        DO NOT MODIFY THE CONTENTS OF THE RETURNED ARRAY.

        Overrides:
        partitionKey in class org.apache.kudu.client.KuduRpc<OperationResponse>

      • getRow

        public PartialRow getRow()
        Get the underlying row to modify.
        Returns:
        a partial row that will be sent with this Operation

      • setRow

        public void setRow(PartialRow row)
        Set the underlying row. Note: The schema of the underlying row and the table must be equal by reference. To ensure they are equal, create the partial row from the table's schema. 
        
   KuduTable table = client.openTable("my-table");
   PartialRow row = table.getSchema().newPartialRow();
   ...
   Operation op = table.newInsert();
   op.setRow(row);
        Parameters:
        row - the row to set
